text:
- ThousandEyes is a network
intelligence company.
So we build visibility
for troubleshooting large-scale networks.

As we've seen more and
more enterprise companies

around the world adopt
the internet as a backbone
to connect their applications
that are increasing within the cloud,

we've built our product
in a way that allows you

to see across any network
without instrumenting
different parts of your network

and visualizing it like
it was your own network.

And one of the things we keep
hearing from our customers is
we want to see into cloud networks
like it was our own network.
Can we actually partner with them

to show visibility like
they saw in the internet
and on-prem?

And this is why we're really
excited to work with AWS

and figure out how can we
better solve customer problems
across AWS and ThousandEyes
so that we can see into cloud networks
and understand cloud performance problems

that you traditionally
wouldn't be able to do

with the tool sets that
you have internally.
The idea being,
customers generally think of ThousandEyes

and they think about
the path visualization

with the hop-by-hop
visualization that we have.
With Path Enrichment,

we're actually using AWS
specific data sources
to show more clearly

where the ingress from
the internet to AWS is.
- With AWS, we have a widely deployed set
of infrastructure across the globe,
which means there's a large surface area
for potential impact
to your application across the internet.
So what we do is we monitor all that

for you across all those
peering interconnects
toward the global internet,
and we make that visibility available
to you via CloudWatch Internet Monitor.

We also have a depth of insight
across our infrastructure
or multiple layers of networking.
But if you're a hybrid customer
whose end users are interacting
with endpoints on other providers,

then Internet Monitor
isn't the full picture.
And so with with ThousandEyes,

ThousandEyes Cloud Agents
and Enterprise Agents

are monitoring toward other
content delivery networks,
toward other providers.

And so by integrating Internet
Monitor into ThousandEyes,

there's that one stop shop
where customers can go
to see their holistic experience.
- Now we're actually providing observed
versus expected latency,

so customers can actually
use the visibility

and data to ensure that
they're getting the most
out of their investment in AWS.
We also
announced the ability to
do test recommendations

and agent recommendations using
CloudWatch Internet Monitor.
CloudWatch Internet Monitor
is customized to your traffic profile.

And so we can actually use
a custom traffic profile

from CloudWatch Internet
Monitor to generate tests

and agent recommendations that
allow our mutual customers

to be able to get up
to speed very quickly,
and at the same time get the visibility
that they need end to end.
- And we're also continuing to listen
to what customers want

in the network performance
monitoring space.
And as we continue to listen to that,

that's going to feed future
capabilities that we offer.
And each step along the way,
we'll look for partnership opportunities

that can really give a
compelling experience
to our customer.

And that's why I'm
grateful to have been able to
partner with ThousandEyes

on this first step at the
beginning of this journey.
